question: Which characteristics apply to stateless architectures that enable horizontal scaling? (Select ALL)
options: Server-side session data must be shared
Workload can be distributed across identical instances
Failure of one instance does not affect client state
correct_answers: Workload can be distributed across identical instances
Failure of one instance does not affect client state

question: Which cloud characteristic best enables elastic scaling?

A startup deploys a web application on a cloud platform and wants to use horizontal scaling to handle unpredictable traffic spikes. Which application property is most essential before horizontal scaling can be effective?
options: Each request must be served over a persistent TCP connection
Application servers must store user session state locally
Requests must be independent of server-side state
The application must use UDP instead of TCP
correct_answers: Requests must be independent of server-side state

question: A company requires a custom operating system and customized platform software to deliver its service, while still wanting elastic scaling. Which cloud service model best fits this requirement?
options: SaaS, because infrastructure management is fully abstracted
PaaS, because the OS and platform are hidden from the user
IaaS, because it offers control over OS and system software
SaaS, because it scales automatically without customization
correct_answers: IaaS, because it offers control over OS and system software
